label: Leads - 2nd-We want you on our team

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'), 

 

Become Part of the Team!

 

We're so excited to show you some of the skills you'll learn, and what it's like to be a part of the Gracie Barra Team! Just to get a quick glimpse, click on the link below :
ADULT PROGRAM
KIDS PROGRAM

Let's Get Started.  Please reply to this email with a day and time that would work best for you to schedule the intro.  This intro class is at no cost to you!

 

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Become Part of the Gracie Barra Team!

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

Thank you for your interest in Gracie Barra Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and Self Defense. It has been about a month since you reached out to us. We have been trying to connect with you to set up your intro class at no cost to you.

 

We know how life can get busy with work, school and family. Even through all of the hustle and bustle of your daily grind, you found time to reach out to us to learn a little more about Gracie Barra Jiu Jitsu. Now it's time to take the next step and set up that intro class for you or your child!

values.Subject: Give yourself a chance. Why train martial arts?

label: Leads - 14 days after the intro class

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name')! 

 

Here are another 7 reasons why Gracie Barra Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is awesome!


1) Dealing with failure – If you can show me someone who hasn’t failed in their life, I’ll show you someone who’s not living life to their full potential. When you train in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu you will have times you will lose. How will you deal with it? Will you let your emotions take over? Quit? Get angry? Retaliate? Or will you learn from the experience and grow? Embrace failure; it may be the best education you will ever get.


2) Patience – Life can be hard and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is no different. It takes a long time to become proficient. It takes years to earn new belts. Those who start, encounter adversity and quit have lost sight of what having patience will reward them- both on the mats as well as most of the areas of their life. When we let ourselves quit, we devalue ourselves. You need to be patient to grow.


3) Humility – Not everyone has humility, but it is a lesson taught daily in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. There is so much to learn. You will learn things from your instructors, training partners and students. It never stops. There is great humility learned knowing that we can practice something for over 30 years and still learn from someone half our age or someone with less time studying than ourselves.


4) Community – Becoming a Gracie Barra Student you join the biggest Jiu-Jitsu organization in the world. You will meet the most amazing people on the mats and experience the family environment and mutual support that come from all four corners of the world.

 

5) Encouraging Non-Violent Conflict Resolution – If you think that Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu promotes violent behavior is justified, then your knowledge probably comes from television or movies. In fact, Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu teaches us peaceful, non-violent conflict resolution skills and emphasizes the importance of avoiding a physical altercation.


6) Developing Teamwork Skills – Whether you are training to get a new belt or sparring in a practice setting to master a new maneuver, most of the things we do in our Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu classes require a training partner. Working together to learn new things and accomplish goals is an important life lesson for anyone to learn.


7) Improvement in Other Areas of Life – The benefits of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu training don’t end when you step off the mats. The boost in confidence, increased fitness level and sense of belonging to a very special group of human beings will definitely change the way you see life and engage with it. Others around you will quickly notice the positive changes and get inspired to do the same. Prepare yourself to become an unintentional role model to the people in your life!


Flavio's motivational video: https://youtu.be/jqXGpk5F7E0

 

Kind Regards,

${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Don't Give Up On Yourself

label: Members - 0 days after converted from a lead

values.Email Content:
Dear member('First Name') member('Last Name'),

 

Welcome to the team!

 

We are very excited and honoured that you chose ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} for your Jiu-Jitsu journey. Whether you're new to BJJ, or have trained in the past, we're confident that you're experience on and off the mats with us will be very positive.

 

You can expect from the GB staff the highest quality of instruction, motivation, and encouragement. The most important thing we expect from you is consistent attendance. There's a lot to learn, and we can't wait to teach you the GB curriculum of techniques created by Master Carlos Gracie Jr.

 

If you ever have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to ask any of our staff members. Be sure to check out our website at ${spaceAttributes('School Website')} for all kinds of great information including the history of Gracie Barra, the schedule, instructor bios, and much more.

 

A copy of your agreement will be emailed to you. One of the biggest challenges you’ll face as a white belt is learning the correct way to tie your pants and belt...it’s even a challenge for a lot of our purple belts! :-) If you’re not sure how to do this yet, check out this video from Gracie Barra World Champion Instructor Prof. Flavio Almeida. www.youtube.com/watch?v=BJFB80epKJo

 

Again, welcome to Gracie Barra...let the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu journey begin! See you on the mats! 

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Email Content:
Hello member('First Name') member('Last Name'),

So you’ve been training a couple weeks now and loving your classes. How would you like a free team t-shirt? It’s easy, all you have to do is let people know how much you like Gracie Barra! Give us a review on Facebook and Google, show us your review and you get your choice of a Gracie Barra Team t-shirt! Here’s how you do it.

 

For Facebook: Login then go to ${spaceAttributes('School Email')} Make sure you Like us! Scroll down to the reviews section and leave yours!

For Google Go to https://maps.google.com/ or open the google maps app on your phone. Type in ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} , click on our school Scroll down to “Write a Review” and leave yours!

 

All the best, ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} staff

${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

 

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

So you’ve been training a couple weeks now and loving your classes. How would you like a free team t-shirt? It’s easy, all you have to do is let people know how much you like Gracie Barra! values.Subject: Free Gracie Barra Tshirt for you!

label: Members - 30 days after converted from a lead

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

The greatest compliment anyone of our students can give Gracie Barra is the referral of a friend or family member.

 

With Jiu-Jitsu, not only are you learning the most effective martial art on the planet, but you're getting in great shape, and developing friendships that will last a lifetime! Why not share this experience with friends and family members?


As a big thank you, at any time you refer someone who becomes a student, we will pay for one month of your training!


You get to share the benefits of BJJ with a loved one, and also get a special gift!


Here are some easy ideas of the best ways to refer someone:


1)You can provide us with the name and number and we will be glad to call your friend to set up their first class.

 

2) Or just simply tell your friend to mention you when they first call our school.


3) If you prefer, you could just simply let us know that you are bringing a friend with you to your next class and we will have a uniform ready for them.

 

Thank you for being such a great supporter of our team!

 

Kind Regards,
${spaceAttributes('School Name')} staff

 

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: The greatest compliment.

label: Members - 90 days after converted from a lead

values.Email Content:
Hello member('First Name') member('Last Name'),

 

You made it through your first 3 months and you’re probably feeling a lot stronger! You’ve probably had some ups & downs, some bumps in the road, but you are well on the way of your jiu jitsu journey.

 

Remember to always have fun and keep a positive attitude! You had some questions when you started and maybe you have a few more now. Have you thought about taking a private lesson?

 

One of the best ways to improve your game can be personal training with one of our coaches.

 

We would like to give you 25% off of your first private class. Just see one of the staff members and mention this email to get setup with a private class with the coach of your choice and get your 25% discount.

 

All the best, 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')} staff

 

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Here is a gift for you!

label: Members - 120 days after converted from a lead

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),


Here are 50 Tips For BJJ White Belts

 

1. One of the best decision you made for yourself is to choose Gracie Barra as your Jiu Jitsu School. The family and positive supportive environment is amazing in our school, so get involved, be an active part of the team as much as you can. Make friends, join the special classes and events at your school, attend tournaments as a supporter or competitor, yourself and our team is stronger because of you!

 

2. Make short-term goals. Whatever it is, just like perfecting an armbar defence, mount escape, guard passing skills. It will help you stay focused.

 

3. Make friends! Jiu jitsu is a team game. Nobody drills with lonely wolves.

 

4. Notion of Victory in jiu jitsu is related to how many lessons you learn from your fails, not how many people you will defeat.

 

5. Promote positive vibes, don’t bring your problems to the mat. The atmosphere in the academy depends on each student.

 

6. Learn how the belt promotion system works and keep a clean communication with your instructor about it. The belt system and attendance cards are tools to help your instructor to know when you are eligible for your next promotion, but the most important one and ultimately the decision to move you up on the ranks is with your instructor. That is why a clean good
communication from both parts is crucial, so you can understand better what is expected from you so you can go chase what matters for your development as a Jiu jitsu practitioner. An environment. Having said that, make sure that you enjoy your journey, the ups and downs and focus on developing good technique and teamwork.

 

7. Don’t do things fast, do it right.

 

8. Never underestimate anyone. In jiu jitsu you never know who is hiding under the Gi.

 

9. Remember in bjj aggression is always synonym for mistake.

 

10. Gi is your second skin, clean it regularly.

 

11. Patience wins. Focused mind is your best weapon.

 

12. Don’t avoid rolling with heavier and taller guys. It will teach you how to react in different situations.

 

13. Fight stronger grapplers. It will reveal your weak sides that you need to improve.

 

14. Don’t roll with serious injuries. A few days of rest are better than a 6 months rehabilitation period.

 

15. Leave ‘Win at all costs’ mentality for competitions. You will learn more moves, transitions and escapes.

 

16. Take time to practice Judo throws and stay focus when learning those take downs.

 

17. While you are newbie learn different techniques, don’t just stick with techniques you have already found effective, you need to develop understanding of jiu jitsu motoric.

 

18. Be attentive with the basics. In Jiu Jitsu you always want learn something new, but it shouldn’t affect ABC techniques.

 

19. In lifelong frame jiu jitsu is more like a game than a fight. Keep it in mind when something doesn’t work, it will help you find the right keys.

 

20. Suppress the hate and envy. It is always hiding somewhere on the mat, so stay away from it.

 

21. Don’t be afraid to use risky techniques while rolling, you will discover your potential.

 

22. You don’t fight a person, you fight his positions. Your attitude should be nothing apart from respect. Bad feelings lead to bad moves.

 

23. Learn how to feel comfortable in uncomfortable situations.

 

24. Eat healthy, follow a balanced diet. This means enough carbs, fats and proteins.

 

25. Listen to your body, if you are overstrained, take a rest. Mentally as well as physically.

 

26. Supplements and diet. Jiu jitsu is high intensity workout that requires maximum effort from your body and your daily menu usually doesn’t cover even half of the required dosage. Be aware of what your body needs to perform and recover well.

 

27. Remember Grip of your opponent is Bad, avoid it like a fire.

 

28. Don’t keep questions inside your head trying to find an answer yourself. You have a teacher who will be glad to share with you his knowledge.

 

29. If you say roll light – roll light.

 

30. Accept advice and tips from others, one day you can use them, so just keep filling your jiu jitsu database.

 

31. To beat an upper belt doesn’t mean to deserve a promotion.

 

32. You have to accept that you will fail many times before you will start winning.

 

33. You teacher scores not quantity but quality.

 

34. Don’t skip sparrings/rolls, your teacher makes notes.

 

35. Do conditioning, in jiu jitsu it goes right after techniques.

 

36. Try to use technique over strength.

 

37. Depending on how you learn best it may be helpful to make a list of learned techniques.

 

38. Time to time do No Gi class as well, it will teach you what’s going to happen if you have nothing to grab apart from the body parts.

 

39. Watch bjj competitions to see how experienced athletes react on the battlefield. Memorize it!

 

40. Always work on the weak sides and holes in your technique.

 

41. Learn how to use your body type to get more advantages.

 

42. Drill more. Before the class. During the class. After the class. Solo or with a partner.

 

43. Don’t forget about flexibility, stretch every day especially if you have problems with it.

 

44. Practice the techniques you learn during the class.

 

45. Don’t do illegal moves, ask your coach in advance if you have any doubts.

 

46. Learn and improve your grips. Tougher your grip – tougher you are.

 

47. Don’t be afraid to compete, fight not for victory, but for experience.

 

48. Monitor your hydration during the day, it affects many processes in your body.

 

49. Increase quantity of rolls (or their duration) to adapt your body to stress.

 

50. Never lose sight of how much you have progressed since you first started. Don’t fall into the comparison trap, everyone is different and have different goals with Jiu Jitsu. Accept Jiu jitsu into your heart and let it become part of your own identity.

Stay loyal to your team!

 

Kind Regards.

${submitterName}

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

47. Don’t be afraid to compete, fight not for victory, but for experience.

 

48. Monitor your hydration during the day, it affects many processes in your body.

 

49. Increase quantity of rolls (or their duration) to adapt your body to stress.

 

50. Never lose sight of how much you have progressed since you first started. Don’t fall into the comparison trap, everyone is different and have different goals with Jiu Jitsu. Accept Jiu jitsu into your heart and let it become part of your own identity.

Stay loyal to your team!

 

Kind Regards.

${submitterName}

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

label: Members - 6 months after conversion from a lead

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

The greatest compliment anyone of our students can give Gracie Barra is the referral of a friend or family member. With Jiu-Jitsu, not only are you learning the most effective martial art on the planet, but you're getting in great shape, and developing friendships that will last a lifetime!

 

Why not share this experience with friends and family members? As a big thank you, at any time you refer someone who becomes a student, we will pay for one month of your training!

 

You get to share the benefits of BJJ with a loved one, and also get a special gift! Here are some easy ideas of the best ways to refer someone:

 

1)You can provide us with the name and number and we will be glad to call your friend to set up their first class.

 

2) Or just simply tell your friend to mention you when they first call our school.

 

3) if you prefer, you could just simply let us know that you are bringing a friend with you to your next class and we will have a uniform ready for them. Thank you for being such a great supporter of our team!

 

Kind Regards,

${submitterName}

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: It is your day!! Enjoy your gift!

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'), 


We miss you here at ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} and we would love to train with you again. Do you still have your uniform? If so, you are in luck! We are going to give you 30 days of training on us.


The path to black belt can be a long one. Work, family, and life in general can get in your way. There is always something to pull you from the path you set out on when you signed up.

 

The great thing about Gracie Barra Jiu Jitsu is that you can always jump back on that path.


Give us a call and let us know when you are coming back, we can’t wait to see you.


Kind Regards,
${submitterName}


I've seen 1000 people quit! Video:
https://youtu.be/kT2T-cNvm60

Check out this video from Gracie Barra World Champion Flavio Almeida
https://youtu.be/jqXGpk5F7E0


We would love to get you back on the mats. To help you get started back up we are going to invest in your training for a month.


Give us a call if you have any questions, we can’t wait to hear from you!


Kind Regards,
${submitterName}

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Where there is a will, there is a way.

label: Members - When they receive the 3rd stripe on their white belt

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

We would like to congratulate you on getting your third stripe. You have worked so hard and you deserve it! It takes courage to try something new, and we are so happy to see your dedication and commitment to your training pay off. This is a huge milestone in your lifelong journey as a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner.

 

Now you are able to attend any GB1 and GB2 classes.  Please check the our schedule to for our GB2 classes.

 

We want to reward you with 10% off our online store to help you get your new white rashguard and No-Gi shorts! This will be great for you when you to do No-Gi classes and to compete!

 

* Don't wait, this is only valid for the next 2 weeks from ${date}. Valid only at your schools Proshop.

 

We also have your new attendance card ready, but if you still have any question, please do not hesitate to contact us.

 

Kind Regards,
${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

label: Members - When they receive the their blue belt

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

We would like to congratulate you on getting your blue belt. You have worked so hard and you deserve it! It takes a lot of perseverance, attention to details when solving problems, and energy to take on new challenges, and we are so happy to see your dedication and commitment to your training pay off. This is a huge milestone in your lifelong journey as a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner.

 

We want to reward you with 10% off our online store to help you get your new blue rashguard! This will be great for you when you to do No-Gi classes and to compete!

 

* Don't wait, this is only valid for the next 2 weeks from ${date}. Valid only at your schools Proshop.

 

Kind Regards,
${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

I just wanted to send you a quick message to let you know that unfortunately we weren't able to process your membership payment.

 

This could be due to many different reasons including expired cc, lost cc etc.

Please contact the school so we can get your account up to date.

 

Kind Regards,

${submitterName}

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

values.Subject: Membership Matter

label: Members - 60 days after converted from a lead

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),


You made it through your first 2 months and you’re probably feeling a lot stronger!

 

You’ve probably had some ups & downs, some bumps in the road, but you are well on the way of your jiu jitsu journey. Remember to always have fun and keep a positive attitude.


You had some questions when you started and maybe you have a few more now. Have you thought about taking a private lesson?

 

One of the best ways to improve your game can be personal training with one of our coaches.

 

We would like to offer you a 30 minute private class at no cost to you! Just see one of the staff members and mention this email to get setup with a private class with the coach of your choice.

 

Let us know what you want to work on and we can tailor the session to you!

 

Kind Regards,
${submitterName}

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Here is a gift for you!

label: Members - When they receive the their purple belt

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

We would like to congratulate you on getting your purple belt. You have worked so hard and you deserve it! Hard work is necessary to get things done, and we are so happy to see your dedication and commitment to your training pay off. This is a huge milestone in your lifelong journey as a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner. 

 

We want to reward you with 10% off our online store to help you get your new purple rash guard! This will be great for you when you to do No-Gi classes and to compete! 

 

* Don't wait, this is only valid for the next 2 weeks from ${date}. Valid only at your schools Proshop.

 

Kind Regards,
${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

We are so happy to see your dedication and commitment to your training pay off. This is a huge milestone in your lifelong journey as a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner. 

 

We want to reward you with 10% off our online store to help you get your new brown rashguard! This will be great for you when you to do No-Gi classes and to compete! This offer is only valid for two weeks from ${date}.

 

Kind Regards,
${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

values.Subject: Congratulations On Your Brown Belt = Patience

label: Members - When they receive the their black belt

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

We would like to congratulate you on getting your black belt. You have worked so hard and you deserve it! The black belt is where you embrace the idea of serving others and do for others what Jiu-Jitsu and Gracie Barra have done for you.

 

This means serving your students, community, and the larger GB organisation as you share your lessons and expertise – whether that is on the mats or in collaborative efforts to help others who are just beginning their Jiu-Jitsu journey. We are so happy to see your dedication and commitment to your training pay off. This is a huge milestone in your lifelong journey as a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner. 

 

We want to reward you with 10% off our online store to help you get your new black rashguard! This will be great for you when you to do No-Gi classes and to compete! This offer is only valid for two weeks from ${date}.

 

Kind Regards,
${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Congratulations On Your Black Belt = Service

label: Members - When converted from a lead

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),


Thanks for enrolling at [GB School Name], and welcome to the team. When you become part of the team, you become part of the GB family. 

If you're on Facebook please request to join our private group - INSERT GROUP LINK

 

Also if you haven't already please like our social pages
- FACEBOOK PAGE - INSTAGRAM PAGE

 

Here is some important information you need to know: - Training Etiquette - Uniform Guidelines - How To Wash Your Uniform 

 

We have created an account for you to use at ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Members. Go to https://gbschoolname.gbmembers.net to login! You can book in for your classes and change any billing details. Your username is [insert username]. The first time you login, you can create your own password. Let us know if you have any questions with your new account!

 

All of our Instructors are available for private classes if you ever want to learn one-on-one, or speed up your development. We would love to offer you a 30 minute complimentary private class with the Instructor of your choice so you can understand the benefit of these classes!

 

Being connected with our [GB School Name] team members is important within our GB community and also helps with keeping everyone up to date with all the action and ongoing information being sent out. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to contact us on the below contacts.

 

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Welcome To The Gracie Barra Team!

label: Leads - 7 days after the intro class

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name')! 


Here are 7 reasons why Gracie Barra Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is awesome!


1) Fostering Self-Discipline – One of the central elements of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is a focus on self-discipline. Today, we are so accustomed to receiving instant gratification that lessons in self-restraint and discipline aren’t always easy to come by. Anyone with a martial arts background, however, is continually reminded of how essential self-discipline is.


2) Boosting Socialisation Skills – If you don’t always thrive in highly social environments, you may find it easier to get to know people and make new friends when you're in a room filled with peers who share a common interest. Students of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu are able to get to know one another through shared pursuits. Partner-driven forms like jiu jitsu can also foster camaraderie, as they force us to pair off and build our skills together.


3) Encouraging Physical Activity – We all need the extra encouragement from our like-minded teammates. Enrolling ourselves in such a physically demanding pastime not only discourages the sedentary lifestyle we are used to, but also gives us an enjoyable activity that inspires us to keep moving.


4) Learning to Set and Achieve Goals – Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is based around an accomplishment system of coloured belts that signify your level. When we strive toward each new belt, we learn valuable lessons about setting and reaching our goals.


5) Problem solving – Let’s face it. Most people are not great problem solvers, most are complainers. Problem solving is like a muscle. The more you exercise it, the better it gets. The problems in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu are more than what the untrained eye sees. It isn’t always about who is faster, stronger, or more flexible. You need timing, strategy, assessment, and calmness. If you are about to get submitted, you need to do some problem solving. Panic usually will end badly. You need to think clear when you are in a struggle and yes sometimes the best solution is to tap out and reset.


6) Increased Self-Esteem – Confidence comes with achievement, so our self-esteem level will get a boost with every new move we master and every belt we earn. The ones who struggle with a low sense of self-worth usually become more confident as time progresses while training in a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu class. You will understand truly how much you are capable of.


7) Instilling a Sense of Respect – Learning Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu will require to show your instructor and teammates with unflinching respect. Today’s culture doesn’t always include respect for authority, adults or those in advanced positions. When attending our practices, we will be learning lessons in respect along with new moves. Plus self respect is a huge deal.
Flavio's motivational video: https://youtu.be/jqXGpk5F7E0

 

Kind Regards,

${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

 

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Give Yourself A Chance

label: Members - Once cancellation from has been completed

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'), 

 

This email is to confirm that we have successfully cancelled your membership as per request on [Request Date]. We are sorry to hear that you are canceling your membership. 

 

If you are cancelling because you are not seeing results or have lost motivation, feel free to speak to us. We can help reinvigorate your training by offering you a 30 minute private training session free of charge with one of our qualified instructors. The session will be tailored to your level, experience and goals and are aimed to improve your jiu-jitsu, motivate and get you back on track. Feel free to contact us to take advantage of the option above or to hear more ways we can help you achieve your goals.

 

Please note that we need 30 days notice in order for your cancellation to take effect in our system, as per your policy. As such, your final payment will be on [insert date] (and remember that you can still train during this time). We hope you have enjoyed your training at ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} and hope to see you back on the mat in the future.

Should you have any questions please let me know.

 

Kind Regards,

 

I've seen 1000 people quit! Video:
https://youtu.be/kT2T-cNvm60

 

${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

 

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Bambora Member Cancellation

values.Email Content:
Dear Students and Families,

 

We hope all is well with you, and that your experience on the mat at ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} continues to be filled with great Jiu-Jitsu, learning, fun, and friendship.


We are so proud of the work that ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} has been doing in our community for the past several years.  Changing people's lives through Jiu-Jitsu in a positive family environment is our mission. We've made a concerted effort to keep tuition at the same rates, even as the cost of doing business continues to rise significantly year after year. Therefore, we have made the decision to implement a new consistent pricing policy that may affect your current membership setup.
These additional fees will allow ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} to keep up with rising costs, adding more staff, and improve compensation for our current employees, as well as keeping the overall health of the school so we can continue to provide you with the best experience possible.

 

Our current price policy is $48.62 per week, for our current students which represents an average of $16 per class for a single member.

 

All members are charged $97.26 on a bi-weekly basis.

 

If your tuition is monthly, it will be changed to bi-weekly.

In full transparency, this will result in an increase of about $21 per month or less per member.

For those of you coming 3 times per week, this is only $1.80 per class more on average.


We are still confident that Jiu-Jitsu continues to be the most economical and most reasonably priced activity for you and your family. We are thankful and appreciate you, and we hope that you continue to see the amazing benefits of what we have to offer.


As always, please feel free to reach out with any questions or concerns.


${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

 

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Gracie Barra Arcadia Membership Update

values.Email Content:
Dear ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Students and Parents,

We hope all is well with you, and that your experience on the mat at ${spaceAttributes('School Name')}  continues to be filled with great Jiu-Jitsu, learning, and fun!


The main purpose of this email is to inform you that ${spaceAttributes('School Name')}  will be transitioning to the new GB Members Software for school operations, management, and billing. This software was built by Gracie Barra... for Gracie Barra. It's our belief that the specific capabilities and features of this management tool will help in giving our school an even better overall experience.


It's important that we disclose to you that going forward a small admin fee of 1.33% of your tuition will be added to your tuition dues. 


We've made a concerted effort to keep tuition at the same rates, even as the cost of doing business continues to rise year after year. This small additional fee will allow us to keep tuition steady, while helping our school to remain healthy.


As always, please feel free to reach out with any questions or concerns.


-- 


Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

Hey member('First Name'), how are you?

 

The Team and I haven't seen you for a little bit, so I wanted to reach out to see when we'll have you back on the mat with us?

 

We hope that all is well! Please let us know if there is anything you need from us.

 

Have a great day!

 

- ${submitterName}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

We haven't been able to reach you yet to set up your intro class at Gracie Barra.

 

This intro class is at no cost to you! An intro class is a great way to experience Jiu-Jitsu for the first time in a family-friendly, fun and safe environment!

 

To get a quick glimpse, click on the link below: 
ADULT PROGRAM
KIDS PROGRAM

Challenge yourself, start TODAY.  Please reply to this email with a day and time that would work best for you to schedule the intro.  This intro class is at no cost to you!

 

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Challenge Yourself!

values.Email Content:
Hello member('First Name'),

 

Are you interested in registering for an IBJJF Competition?

 

Here is how you register for the first time: 

 

Access https://ibjjf.com/athletes/become-a-member
Choose “Are you a first-time membership applicant?”
Enter the requested information (Birth Date, Belt, and Country)
Create your athlete login and fill out your information
Open a new membership request and upload all required documents.
Academy is Gracie Barra Arizona 

Professor is Paulo Edurado Viera Nunes Freire (he will sign electronically)

 

Please note:

  • The membership request will not be submitted for review until all of the required documents have been uploaded to the online request.
  • Once your registration is approved, you can sign up for any No-Gi competitions under IBJFF. 
  • The registration is valid for one year

Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need any assistance.

 

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: IBJJF Registration

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'), 

 

Thank you for your interest in our school! Gracie Barra is the largest jiu-jutsu team in the world with over 950 schools worldwide. ${spaceAttributes('School Name')} is proud to be a part of the Gracie Barra legacy, and now you have a chance to be a part of that legacy too! 

 

We would like to invite you or your child to come to try an intro class with us, at no cost to you! This is a great opportunity for you to know our school, our instructors and experience a jiu-jitsu class.  Reply to this email with you preferred method of contact to schedule that class.  Looking forward to seeing you on the mats.

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

values.Subject: Special Schedule

values.Email Content:
Hi member('First Name'),

 

Thank you for your interest in Gracie Barra Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and Self Defense.  We have been trying to connect with you to set up your intro class at no cost to you. We know how life can get busy with work, school and family. Even though all of the hustle and bustle of your daily grind, you found time to reach out to us to learn a little more about Gracie Barra Jiu Jitsu.

 

Now it's time to take the next step and set up that intro class for you or your child!

 

Gracie Barra will get you in the best shape of your life while you learn the most effective martial art on the planet in a fun, clean, safe, and family oriented environment.
ADULT PROGRAM
KIDS PROGRAM

Check out our programs.  Please reply to this email with a day and time that would work best for you to schedule the intro.  This intro class is at no cost to you!

 

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

Please let us know if you have any issues or questions.

 

Kind Regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

Hi ${values('Student First Name')},

 

Congratulations on the start of your BJJ journey.

 

Your member registration details are as follows:
Student Name ${values('Student First Name')} ${values('Student Last Name')}
Include Family Members ${values('Include Family Members')}
Payment Frequency ${vars('payment_frequency')}

Members

NameProgramFee
Canada Custom GB Membership - GB Bi-weekly 99.98
Membership ${values('Fee Total')}
${vars('admin_label')} ${vars('admin_fee')}
I promise to pay equal ${vars('payment_frequency')} instalments of ${values('I promise to pay equal FREQUENCY instalments of')}

values.Email Content:
Sold To: ${values('Person Name')}
${vars('ApparelsTable')} ${vars('ServicesTable')} ${vars('PackagesTable')}
${vars('subTotal')} ${vars('discountInfo')} ${vars('salesTaxInfo')} ${vars('totalInfo')} ${vars('refundInfo')}

Card Number: ${values('Card Number')}

Date: ${vars('transactionDate')}

${spaceAttributes('School Name')}

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}

Hello member('First Name') member('Last Name'),


We're excited to share some great news with you – your journey with Gracie Barra is about to resume!

Here's What You Need to Know:

  • Membership Resumption Date: $DATE{${values('Resume Date')}}
  • Membership Fee: $${values('Membership Cost')}
  • Billing Frequency: ${values('Billing Payment Period')}

Your membership will automatically reactivate on the resume date mentioned above. We can't wait to welcome you back to the mats and continue our journey together in the art of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

What's Next?

  • Prepare for Training: Make sure your gear is ready, and you're set to return.
  • Stay Updated: Check out our latest class schedules and upcoming events on our website or app.
  • Reach Out: If you have any questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to contact us. 

We're looking forward to seeing you again. The Gracie Barra community is a family, and every member's presence strengthens our bond and passion for BJJ.

Thank you for being a valued part of our Gracie Barra family. We look forward to seeing you soon and continuing our journey together.

Warm regards,

${spaceAttributes('School Name')} Team

Address: ${spaceAttributes('School Address')}

Phone: ${spaceAttributes('School Telephone')}
